text: I have a Simulink model that I would like to call in Julia and take it’s derivative in Julia. I would prefer not to rewrite the Simulink model as it is very complex. What would be the best way to do this? Or could you point me to a couple of libraries I could look into more? I am very new to Julia.

elements.text: I have a Simulink model that I would like to call in Julia and take it’s derivative in Julia. I would prefer not to rewrite the Simulink model as it is very complex. What would be the best way to do this? Or could you point me to a couple of libraries I could look into more? I am very new to Julia.

text: Since you don't have the code in Julia, the only thing you can do is use <https://github.com/JuliaDiff/FiniteDifferences.jl> or something similar to take finite differences

or something similar to take finite differences

text: <@U0179G7FG4F> Thank you! I was afraid of that. I was hoping that there might be some sort of trick to enable AD. Thanks for the feedback! I’ll check out that library

text: yeah. AD isn't a magic bullet. For it to work you need source code.

elements.text: yeah. AD isn't a magic bullet. For it to work you need source code.

text: I hear some magicians are cooking up something called Enzyme… but differentiating all the way through Simulink might be too much to hope for.
